glsa.title: Asterisk: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in Asterisk might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Asterisk is an open source telephony engine and toolkit.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Asterisk:

ul.li: An error in manager.c allows shell access through the MixMonitor application, GetVar, or Status (CVE-2012-2414).
An error in chan_skinny.c could cause a heap-based buffer overflow (CVE-2012-2415).
An error in chan_sip.c prevents Asterisk from checking if a channel exists before connected line updates (CVE-2012-2416).
An error in chan_iax2.c may cause an invalid pointer to be called (CVE-2012-2947).
chan_skinny.c contains a NULL pointer dereference (CVE-2012-2948).

impact.p: A remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Asterisk users should upgrade to the latest version:
